Class Range

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.util.Range

  • public class Range
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a numeric range.

      • checkUnitRange

        public static boolean checkUnitRange(double v,
                     java.lang.String label)
        Ensure the given value is in the unit range.
        Parameters:
        v - The value to check.
        label - If not null and the value given is not within the range [0, 1] then an exception thrown using the given label as identifier.
        Returns:
        true iff the given value is in the range [0, 1], otherwise false if label == null, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown indicating that the value identified by label is not in the correct range.

      • checkUnitRange

        public static boolean checkUnitRange(double v,
                     java.lang.String label,
                     boolean minInclusive,
                     boolean maxInclusive)
        Ensure the given value is in the unit range, with either the minimum or maximum value being exclusive.
        Parameters:
        v - The value to check.
        label - If not null and the value given is not within the unit range then an exception thrown using the given label as identifier.
        minInclusive - Whether the start of the range (0) should be inclusive.
        maxInclusive - Whether the end of the range (1) should be inclusive.
        Returns:
        true iff the given value is in the unit range, otherwise false if label == null, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown indicating that the value identified by label is not in the correct range.

      • checkRange

        public static boolean checkRange(double v,
                 java.lang.String label,
                 double min,
                 double max)
        Ensure the given value is in the specified range.
        Parameters:
        v - The value to check.
        label - If not null and the value given is not within the range [min, max] then an exception thrown using the given label as identifier.
        min - The start of the range.
        max - The end of the range.
        Returns:
        true iff the given value is in the range [min, max], otherwise false if label == null, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown indicating that the value identified by label is not in the correct range.

      • checkRange

        public static boolean checkRange(double v,
                 java.lang.String label,
                 double min,
                 double max,
                 boolean minInclusive,
                 boolean maxInclusive)
        Ensure the given value is in the specified range, with either the minimum or maximum value being exclusive.
        Parameters:
        v - The value to check.
        label - If not null and the value given is not within the range then an exception thrown using the given label as identifier.
        min - The start of the range.
        max - The end of the range.
        minInclusive - Whether the start of the range (min) should be inclusive.
        maxInclusive - Whether the end of the range (max) should be inclusive.
        Returns:
        true iff the given value is in the range [0, 1], otherwise false if label == null, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown indicating that the value identified by label is not in the correct range.
